menu_game_paused._context: Displayed at the top of the game paused menu

menu_resume_game._context: Text of the button that closes the paused menu and resumes the game

menu_save_game._context: Text of the button that saves the game as a file at its previous save location

menu_save_game_as._context: Text of the button that prompts the user for a save location and then saves the game as a file at that location

menu_choose_save_location._context: Title of the window that prompts the user for a save location

menu_save_file._context: Name of the file format ('.bin') used to store a save file (storing game progress)

menu_to_main_menu._context: Text of the button that returns the user to the main menu

menu_new_game._context: Text of the button used to start a new game

menu_mode_tutorial._context: Text of the button used to start a new game by playing the tutorial, which teaches the player the basics of the game and its mechanics.

menu_mode_descr_tutorial.de: Spiele das Tutorial, welches nach Abschluss in ein klassisches Spiel √ºbergeht. (Empfohlen f√ºr neue Spieler)
menu_mode_descr_tutorial.en: Play the tutorial, which transitions into a classic game after completition. (Recommended for new players)

menu_mode_classic._context: Text of the button used to create a new game without playing the tutorial or the opening cutscenes.

menu_mode_descr_classic.de: Starte ein neues klassisches Spiel ohne das Tutorial oder jegliche andere √Ñnderungen.
menu_mode_descr_classic.en: Start a new classic game without the tutorial or any other changes.

menu_mode_creative._context: Text of the button used to create a new game with unlimited money and all research already unlocked.

menu_mode_descr_creative.de: Starte ein neues Spiel mit unlimitiertem Geld und allen Forschungen bereits abgeschlossen.
menu_mode_descr_creative.en: Start a new game with unlimited money and all research already unlocked.

menu_load_previous_game._context: Text of a button used to load a previously loaded game
menu_load_previous_game._placeholders: The path (or part of it) of the previously loaded game

menu_load_game._context: Text of the button used to load a specific file

menu_choose_load_location._context: Title of the window that prompts the user for a load location

menu_settings._context: Text of the button used to open the game settings

menu_exit_game._context: Text of the button used to close the game

menu_save_file_too_old._context: Shown when a save file from an older version of the game is attempted to be loaded
menu_save_file_too_old.de: Die geladene Spieldatei kann nur mit einer √§lteren Version des Spiels geladen werden. :(
menu_save_file_too_old.en: The selected save file can only be loaded with an older version of the game. :(

menu_save_file_too_new._context: Shown when the player attempts to load a save file from a newer version of the game
menu_save_file_too_new.de: Diese Version des Spiels ist zu alt. Verwenden sie eine neuere Version, um die gew√§hlte Spieldatei zu laden.
menu_save_file_too_new.en: This version of the game is outdated. Use a newer version of the game to load the selected file.

menu_loading._context: Shown when the game is loading for a longer amount of time

menu_copyright_notice._context: The copyright notice text as displayed in the main menu

menu_music_volume._context: Displayed over the slider that controls the music volume

menu_sound_volume._context: Displayed over the slider that controls the volume of sound effects

menu_view_distance._context: Displayed over the slider that controls the view distance of the game

menu_yes._context: Text of a button that shows that a setting is enabled

menu_no._context: Text of a button that shows that a setting is disabled

menu_left._context: Text of a button that shows that signals are to be placed on the left side of tracks

menu_right._context: Text of a button that shows that signals are to be placed on the right side of tracks

menu_signal_side._context: Setting for setting the side that train signals should be placed on.

menu_fullscreen._context: Setting for making the game run in fullscreen mode

menu_dithering._context: Setting for toggling dithering in shaders, using small repeating patterns to simulate intermediate colors in a limited palette.

menu_pixelation._context: Setting for toggling pixelated rendering. When enabled, the game renders at a fixed lower resolution, maintaining a retro look. When disabled, it renders at the full window resolution.

menu_ui_size._context: Displayed over the slider that controls the size of the user interface

menu_close_menu._context: Confirms and closes the current menu (e.g. credits, settings)

ui_building_selection._context: Title of the building selection UI (when building a building)

ui_product_selection._context: Title of the product selection UI (of a building when selecting it)

ui_required_workers._context: The number of workers needed by a building

ui_workers_working._context: Shows the player that the building is being operated by a sufficent number of workers

ui_workers_shortage._context: Shows the player that there are not enough available workers to operate the building

ui_workers_unreachable._context: Shows the player that the building cannot be reached by workers

ui_workers_unemployment._context: Shows how many unallocated workers are remaining out of a group of populations, in comparison to the total population
ui_workers_unemployment._placeholders: #1: number of unallocated workers; #2: total sum of workers

ui_item_storage_capacity._contxt: The number of items an agent (carriage, boat, train, ...) can carry at a time

ui_bridge_selection._context: Title of the bridge type selection UI (when building a bridge)

ui_building_complex._context: Title of the building complex (a collection of buildings) information UI

ui_inputs._context: The optimal consumption / inputs of a building complex

ui_outputs._context: The optimal outputs / products of a building complex (given the optimal inputs are met)

ui_storage._context: Lists the stored items of a building complex underneath

ui_empty._context: Displayed when a building complex or carriage does not hold any items, or when the schedule of a carriage is empty

ui_current_position._context: The current position of the player, used in the map legend for the player marker

ui_personal_horse._context: The current position of the player's personal horse, used in the map legend for its marker

ui_carriage._context: Used as the title of the carriage info UI and the current position of a carriage in the map legend for the carriage markers

ui_train._context: Used as the title of the train info UI and the current position of a train in the map legend for the train markers

ui_boat._context: Used as the title of the boat info UI and the current position of a boat in the map legend for the boat markers

ui_status_no_instructions._context: Displayed as the status of a carriage (or other agent like a train) when its schedule (list of places to go to) is empty

ui_status_transferring._context: Displayed as the status of a carriage (or other agent like a train) when it is currently in the process of transferring items at one of its scheduled stops

ui_status_travelling._context: Displayed as the status of a carriage (or other agent like a train) when it is currently travelling to one of its scheduled stops
ui_status_travelling._placeholders: The number of the stop the carriage is currently travelling to

ui_status_lost._context: Displayed as the status of a carriage (or other agent like a train) when it has no valid path to its next scheduled stop (it is 'lost')
ui_status_lost._placeholders: The number of the stop the carriage is trying to travel to

ui_remove_carriage._context: Text of the button used to remove / scrap (no refund) a carriage

ui_remove_train._context: Text of the button used to remove / scrap (no refund) a train

ui_remove_boat._context: Text of the button used to remove / scrap (no refund) a boat

ui_train_add_car._context: Text of the button used to append a car to a train

ui_train_remove_car._context: Text of the button used to remove a car from a train

ui_schedule._context: The schedule (list of stops the carriage is scheduled to go to, and what to do once there) of a carriage (or other agent like a train)

ui_pick_up._context: Schedule item can be set to 'Pick up' items (move items from carriage to buildings) at some set building complex (or other location)

ui_drop_off._context: Schedule item can be set to 'Drop off' items (move items from buildings to carriage) at some set building complex (or other location)

ui_maintain._context: Schedule item can be set to 'Maintain' a certain level of items at some set building complex (or other location)

ui_add_stop._context: Button used to add a building complex as a stop to a carriage's schedule

ui_click_target_complex._context: Prompts the user to click the building complex the carriage should stop at on the map

ui_on_board._context: Same as 'ui_storage', but for agents (carriages, trains, boats, ...) - Lists the stored items on board of the vehicle underneath
ui_on_board._placeholders: #1: number of items on board; #2: number of items that can fit into the agent

ui_condition_required_conditions._context: Shown in the research viewer - title of the section that tells the user what other conditions they need to first unlock before unlocking a given condition

ui_condition_required_items._context: Shown in the research viewer - title of the section that tells the user how much they need to produce to unlock the given condition

ui_condition_rewards._context: Shown in the research viewer - title of the section that tells the user what items or features a given condition unlocks

ui_train_tracks._context: Name for the rails / tracks that trains drive on

toast_saved_game._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the game has been saved
toast_saved_game._placeholders: The location that the game has been saved at

toast_auto_saved_game._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the game has been saved automatically

toast_failed_to_save_game._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the game could not be saved
toast_failed_to_save_game.en: üíæ Game was unable to be saved.

toast_failed_to_auto_save_game._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the game could not be saved automatically
toast_failed_to_auto_save_game.de: üíæ Spiel konnte nicht automatisch gespeichert werden, da kein valider Speicherpfad festgelegt wurde.
toast_failed_to_auto_save_game.en: üíæ Game was unable to be saved automatically as no valid save path has been specified.

toast_indestructible._context: Pop-up that notifies the user when they try to demolish buildings they aren't allowed to (note: localized text should be why they can't do it, not what they did)
toast_indestructible.de: Dieses Geb√§ude kann nicht abgerissen werden.
toast_indestructible.en: This building may not be demolished.

toast_terrain_occupied._context: Pop-up that notifies the user when they try to modify terrain under a building, bridge or train tracks (note: localized text should be why they can't do it, not what they did)
toast_terrain_occupied.de: Gel√§nde unter Strukturen kann nicht bearbeitet werden!
toast_terrain_occupied.en: Terrain occupied by structures may not be modified!

toast_tracks_occupied._context: Pop-up that notifies the user when they try to delete train tracks with trains on them (note: localized text should be why they can't do it, not what they did)
toast_tracks_occupied.de: Schienen unter Z√ºgen k√∂nnen nicht entfernt werden!
toast_tracks_occupied.en: Train tracks occupied by trains may not be removed!

toast_invalid_building_placement._context: Pop-up that notifies the user when they try to place a building on uneven terrain (note: localized text should be why they can't do it, not what they did)
toast_invalid_building_placement.de: Geb√§ude m√ºssen auf flachem, freiem Bodem platziert werden!
toast_invalid_building_placement.en: Buildings must be placed on flat, unoccupied ground!

toast_building_requires_resource._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the building they attempted to build needs to be placed on a specific resource
toast_building_requires_resource._placeholders: The localized name of the resource it needs to be placed on
toast_building_requires_resource.en: Building needs to be placed on {}!

toast_too_expensive._context: Pop-up that notifies the user when they try to do something they cannot afford
toast_too_expensive._placeholders: The number of coins the operation would cost if they could afford it

toast_added_coins._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that coins have been added to their balance

toast_removed_coins._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that coins have been removed from their balance

toast_no_valid_carriage_location._context: Pop-up that informs the user when they try to create a carriage at a stable, but the stable is not adjacent to any paths
toast_no_valid_carriage_location.de: Kein g√ºltiger Ort f√ºr eine Kutsche in der N√§he!
toast_no_valid_carriage_location.en: There is no valid location for a carriage nearby!

toast_no_valid_train_location._context: Pop-up that informs the user when they try to create a train at a depot, but the depot does not have any tracks in front of it
toast_no_valid_train_location.de: Kein g√ºltiger Ort f√ºr einen Zug in der N√§he!
toast_no_valid_train_location.en: There is no valid location for a train nearby!

toast_no_valid_boat_location._context: Pop-up that informs the user when they try to create a boat at a yard, but the yard does not have any water nearby
toast_no_valid_boat_location.de: Kein g√ºltiger Ort f√ºr ein Boot in der N√§he!
toast_no_valid_boat_location.en: There is no valid location for a boat nearby!

toast_carriage_lost._context: Pop-up that informs that a carriage has now become lost (meaning the carriage can't find a path to its next scheduled stop, related to 'ui_status_lost')

toast_train_lost._context: Pop-up that informs that a train has now become lost (meaning the train can't find a path to its next scheduled stop, related to 'ui_status_lost')

toast_boat_lost._context: Pop-up that informs that a boat has now become lost (meaning the boat can't find a path to its next scheduled stop, related to 'ui_status_lost')

toast_missing_workers._context: Pop-up that informs that some buildings are missing workers, either because they have no way to get to the building or because there is a shortage of workers
toast_missing_workers.de: Ein Geb√§ude hat nicht genug Arbeiter!

toast_personal_horse_travelling._context: Shown when the personal horse is instructed to come to the player usign the [H] button.
toast_personal_horse_travelling.de: Ihr Pferd ist auf dem Weg zu ihnen.
toast_personal_horse_travelling.en: Your horse is on its way to you.

toast_bridge_too_short._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the bridge they attempted to build is too short

toast_bridge_too_high._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the bridge they attempted to build is too high up

toast_bridge_ends_dont_match._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the ends of the bridge they attempted to build are not on the same height
toast_bridge_ends_dont_match.de: Br√ºckenenden sind nicht auf der selben H√∂he!
toast_bridge_ends_dont_match.en: Bridge ends are not on the same height!

toast_research_complete._context: Pop-up that notifies the user that the conditions for some research have been met
toast_research_complete._placeholders: The localized name of the completed research

item_name_coal._context: Name of the coal item and natural resource

item_name_crude_oil._context: Name of the crude oil item and natural resource

item_name_salt._context: Name of the salt item and natural resource

item_name_iron_ore._context: Name of the iron ore item and natural resource

item_name_copper_ore._context: Name of the copper ore item and natural resource

item_name_zinc_ore._context: Name of the zinc ore item and natural resource

item_name_brass_rods._context: Name of the brass rods item

item_name_brass_plates._context: Name of the brass plates item

item_name_brass_gears._context: Name of the brass gears item

item_name_brass_pots._context: Name of the brass pots item

item_name_oil_lanterns._context: Name of the oil lanterns item

item_name_steel_beams._context: Name of the steel beams item

item_name_power_looms._context: Name of the power looms item, a mechanically powered loom used to make fabric

item_name_steam_engines._context: Name of the steam engines item, a machine that converts heat into rotational energy

item_name_locomotive_frames._context: Name of the base part of a steam locomotive

building_category_name_resources._context: Name of the broader category of buildings which have the shared purpose of gathering natural resources

building_category_name_production._context: Name of the broader category of buildings which have the shared purpose of producing goods from other goods

building_category_name_logistics._context: Name of the broader category of buildings which have the shared purpose of aiding in transportation of goods from one place to another

building_name_farmland._context: Name of the 'building' that is a simple field used to grow crops

building_name_mineshaft._context: Name of the 'building' that is used to dig up goods from under the ground

building_name_windmill._context: Name of the building that converts wind power into rotational energy to process goods

building_name_factory._context: Name of the industrial brick building with large chimneys that contains machines to process goods

building_name_house._context: Name of the building that people live in

building_name_stable._context: Name of the building that horses are kept in

building_name_plaza._context: Name of the 'building' that is a market square where merchants can sell goods

building_name_mansion._context: Name of the building that is the villa / mansion the player lives in

building_name_pasture._context: Name of a patch of grass that is used for animals to graze (eat grass)

building_name_tree_farm._context: Name of a piece of land that is used to raise trees for production of wood

building_name_train_depot._context: Name of a large building used to store and maintain trains

building_name_ship_yard._context: Name of a building and the land around it used to construct and maintain ships

building_name_storage._context: Name of a building used to store goods to be used later

building_name_commissary_works._context: Name of a building that produces foods and consumables such as milk, steak, beer, cheese and bread

building_name_manufacturing_works._context: Name of a building that produces machines, gadgets, tools (for example tools, watches, oil lanterns) and other things from smaller components

building_name_cloth_works._context: Name of a building that produces cloth and related products, such as cloth, leather, shirts or sails

building_name_metallurgical_works._context: Name of a building that produces anything related to metal, including steel, brass, other alloys and materials out of those metals, including beams, gears and rods

bridge_name_wooden._context: Name for a bridge made out of wood

bridge_name_stone._context: Name for a bridge made out of stone

bridge_name_metal._context: Name for a bridge made out metal (iron, steel, ...)

carriage_name_round._context: Name of the carriage type that is used to transport goods

carriage_name_passenger._context: Name of the carriage type that is used to transport passengers

locomotive_name_basic._context: Name of the most basic type of locomotive, inspired by the 'Planet' locomotive built by Robert Stephenson.

locomotive_name_small._context: Name of the small type of locomotive, inspired by the LSWR 0298 Class ('Beattie Well Tank') locomotive No. 44 designed by Joseph Beattie.

locomotive_name_tram._context: Name of a small self-propelled type of carriage used to transport passengers, usually along streets urban areas.

boat_name_sail._context: Name of a boat that uses sails for propulsion, used for transport of goods

dialogue_press_to_continue._context: Displayed at the bottom of every dialogue when it is over

dialogue_peasant_0.en: Oh, your lordship! Is there something I can help your lordship with?
dialogue_peasant_0.de: Oh, Herr Graf! Gibt es etwas, womit ich Euch dienen kann?

dialogue_peasant_1.en: That I would one day speak to your lordship... I must tell my children about this!
dialogue_peasant_1.de: Dass ich eines Tages mit Euer Gnaden sprechen w√ºrde... Davon muss ich meinen Kindern erz√§hlen!

dialogue_peasant_2.en: I feel truly proud to live in such a pretty part of the Kingdom.
dialogue_peasant_2.de: Ich bin wirklich stolz darauf, in so einem sch√∂nen Teil des K√∂nigreichs zu leben.

dialogue_peasant_3.en: May the goddess protect your lordship.
dialogue_peasant_3.de: M√∂ge die G√∂ttin √ºber Euer Gnaden wachen.

dialogue_peasant_4.en: I am most honored to be visited by your lordship.
dialogue_peasant_4.de: Es ist mir eine gro√üe Ehre, von Euer Gnaden besucht zu werden.

dialogue_maid_0.en: My lordship, is there possibly any way in which I may assist you?
dialogue_maid_0.de: Euer Gnaden, gibt es m√∂glicherweise etwas, womit ich Euch behilflich sein k√∂nnte?

dialogue_maid_1.en: Is it already time for dinner? I shall start preparations immediately.
dialogue_maid_1.de: Ist es bereits Zeit f√ºr das Abendmahl? Ich werde sogleich mit der Zubereitung beginnen.

dialogue_maid_2.en: If your lordship has any problems with my work, please feel free to speak your mind.
dialogue_maid_2.de: Sollte Euer Gnaden jegliche Beanstandungen an meiner Arbeit haben, so z√∂gert nicht, es mir mitzuteilen.

dialogue_tutorial_0_father_1.en: Come son, let us take a walk.
dialogue_tutorial_0_father_1.de: Komm Sohn, lass uns spazieren gehen.

dialogue_tutorial_0_prompt_2.en: Press [W], [A], [S] and [D] to move around and follow your father.
dialogue_tutorial_0_prompt_2.de: Dr√ºcke [W], [A], [S] und [D], um dich zu bewegen und folge deinem Vater.

dialogue_tutorial_0_father_3.en: The path suddenly ended... Can you see the other end?
dialogue_tutorial_0_father_3.de: Der Pfad endet hier pl√∂tzlich... Kannst du das andere Ende sehen?

dialogue_tutorial_0_prompt_4.en: Use the scroll wheel to zoom the camera in and out.
dialogue_tutorial_0_prompt_4.de: Drehe das Mausrad, um die Kamera heraus- oder hereinzuzoomen.

dialogue_tutorial_0_father_6.en: Take a good look at this land my son, as for one day you shall inherit it.
dialogue_tutorial_0_father_6.de: Schau dir dieses Land gut an, mein Sohn, da du es eines Tages erben wirst.

dialogue_tutorial_1_father_0.en: Son, the first thing I shall teach you is how you can shape the terrain to fit your needs.
dialogue_tutorial_1_father_0.de: Sohn, zuerst m√∂chte ich dir beibringen, wie du den Boden nach deinem Belieben bearbeiten kannst.

dialogue_tutorial_1_prompt_1.en: Click the shovel icon (top icon) in the bottom left or press [G] to start shaping the terrain.
dialogue_tutorial_1_prompt_1.de: Klicke das Schaufel-Symbol (oberstes Symbol) unten links oder dr√ºcke [G], um mit der Gel√§ndebearbeitung anzufangen.

dialogue_tutorial_1_prompt_2.en: Three additional buttons will pop up; use these to choose between flattening, raising and lowering the terrain.
dialogue_tutorial_1_prompt_2.de: Drei weitere Kn√∂pfe werden auftauchen; benutze diese, um zwischen Planieren, Anheben und Absenken zu w√§hlen.

dialogue_tutorial_1_prompt_3.en: Clicking modifies a single point, while dragging modifies a whole area.
dialogue_tutorial_1_prompt_3.de: Klicken modifiziert einen einzelnen Punkt und Ziehen modifiziert einen gesamten Bereich.

dialogue_tutorial_1_father_4.en: Can you flattern the terrain around us?
dialogue_tutorial_1_father_4.de: Kannst du das Gel√§nde um uns herum planieren?

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_0.en: My next lesson for you is about buildings.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_0.de: In meiner n√§chsten Lektion geht es um Geb√§ude.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_1.en: Buildings are the place where your people can produce things for you.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_1.de: Geb√§ude sind der Ort, an dem deine Leute Dinge f√ºr dich produzieren k√∂nnen.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_2.en: However, often they need other resources to produce these things, or sometimes they need to be placed in specific locations (such as mineshafts).
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_2.de: Jedoch brauchen diese oft andere Ressourcen oder m√ºssen an einem bestimmten Ort platziert werden (zum Beispiel Minensch√§chte).

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_3.en: Next to us I have set up a field.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_3.de: Neben uns habe ich ein Feld angelegt.

dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_4.en: Press [M] to open the map. Once open, use the right mouse button to pan the map around and the scroll wheel to zoom in and out.
dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_4.de: Dr√ºcke [M], um die Karte zu √∂ffnen. Wenn ge√∂ffnet kannst du die rechte Maustaste verwenden, um die Karte zu bewegen und das Mausrad drehen, um zu zoomen.

dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_5.en: Clicking a building on the map tells you more information about it and the buildings it's connected to.
dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_5.de: Au√üerdem kannst du ein Geb√§ude auf der Karte anklicken, um mehr √ºber das Geb√§ude und die Geb√§ude, mit denen es verbunden ist, zu erfahren.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_6.en: My task for you is to look at the map and use it to find out about what the farmland produces.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_6.de: Meine Aufgabe an dich ist, dir das Feld auf der Karte anzuschauen, und mir zu sagen, was es produziert.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_7.en: You are correct, this field is in fact producing wheat.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_7.de: Du hast recht, das Feld produziert Weizen.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_8.en: However, the wheat is currently going unused.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_8.de: Jedoch wird der Weizen im Moment nicht verwendet.

dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_9.en: Click the hammer icon (second from the top) in the bottom left or press [C] to start building.
dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_9.de: Klicke das Hammer-Symbol (zweites von oben) unten links oder dr√ºcke [C], um mit dem Bauen anzufangen.

dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_10.en: Another menu will open on the right, allowing you to choose which building to build.
dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_10.de: Ein weiteres Men√º wird sich rechts √∂ffnen, das dir erlaubt, ein Geb√§ude zum Platzieren zu w√§hlen.

dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_11.en: Buildings can also be demolished by pressing the wrecking ball icon (bottom) in the bottom left or by pressing [R]. Clicking a building then demolishes it.
dialogue_tutorial_2_prompt_11.de: Geb√§ude k√∂nnen auch abgerissen werden, indem du das Abrisskugeln-Symbol (ganz unten) unten links anklickst oder [R] dr√ºckst. Klicke dann ein Geb√§ude an, um es abzurei√üen.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_12.en: Can you make a windmill for flour and place it next to the fields?
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_12.de: Kannst du eine Windm√ºhle f√ºr Mehl neben den Feldern platzieren?

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_14.en: However, the windmill isn't producing much since there is no space for all the flour it's producing.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_14.de: Leider produziert die Windm√ºhle jedoch im Moment nicht so viel, weil sie keinen Platz f√ºr das ganze Mehl hat.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_15.en: For this reason I want you to place a storage building next to the farmland or windmill.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_15.de: Deswegen m√∂chte ich, dass du ein Lagergeb√§ude neben dem Feld oder der Windm√ºhle platzierst.

dialogue_tutorial_2_father_16.en: Wonderful. Take a look at the map again and look how much space they have now.
dialogue_tutorial_2_father_16.de: Wundervoll. Schau noch einmal auf die Karte und sieh, wie viel Platz die M√ºhle jetzt hat.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_0.en: Remember how we set up this windmill together a few years ago?
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_0.de: Erinnerst du dich noch daran, wie wir vor ein paar Jahren zusammen diese Windm√ºhle aufgesetzt haben?

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_1.en: We have a bakery in the village to the east of here, and I want to connect the two.
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_1.de: Wir haben eine B√§ckerei im Dorf im Osten von hier, und ich m√∂chte die beiden verbinden.

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_2.en: Press the trowel icon (second from the bottom) in the bottom left or press [V] to start creating paths.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_2.de: Dr√ºcke das Kellen-Symbol (zweites von unten) unten links oder dr√ºcke [V], um mit der Pfaderstellung anzufangen.

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_3.en: Once selected, you can left click to turn a tile into a path and right click to remove paths.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_3.de: Dann kannst du mit Linksklick Pfade erstellen und sie mit Rechtsklick wieder entfernen.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_4.en: Have a look at the map again.
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_4.de: Schau dir nochmal die Karte an.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_5.en: Can you make a path to the bakery in the village east of here?
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_5.de: Kannst du einen Pfad von hier zur B√§ckerei im Dorf im Osten machen?

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_6.en: Use [E] (or click it on screen) when close to your horse to ride it. Press the space bar to get off and press [H] to call for your horse.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_6.de: Dr√ºcke [E] (oder klicke es auf dem Bildschirm) wenn du in der N√§he deines Pferdes bist, um es zu reiten. Dr√ºcke die Leertaste, um abzuspringen und [H], um dein Pferd zu rufen.

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_7.en: Note that many actions (including laying paths) are impossible on a horse.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_7.de: Beachte, dass viele Handlungen (inklusive Pfaderstellung) nicht auf dem Pferd m√∂glich sind.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_9.en: Next, let us use the path you just created to transport the flour from our windmill to the bakery.
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_9.de: Als N√§chstes m√∂chte ich den Pfad verwenden, um das Mehl von der Windm√ºhle zur B√§ckerei zu transportieren.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_10.en: For this, we need a carriage. First, build a stable close to but not on the path.
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_10.de: Daf√ºr brauchen wir eine Kutsche. Baue zuerst einen Pferdestall in der N√§he des Pfads, aber nicht direkt darauf.

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_11.en: Clicking a stable, ship yard or train depot opens a menu on the right that allows you to create vehicles of that type.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_11.de: Klicke einen Pferdestall, eine Werft oder ein Zugdepot an, um ein Men√º zu √∂ffnen, das dir erlaubt, Fahrzeuge des jeweiligen Typs zu erstellen.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_12.en: Next, use the stable to create a goods carriage. We will use it to transport the flour.
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_12.de: Verwende nun den Stall, um eine G√ºterkutsche zu erstellen. Wir werden sie verwenden, um das Mehl zu transportieren.

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_13.en: Clicking a carriage on the map allows you to configure its schedule.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_13.de: Klicke eine Kutsche auf der Karte an, um ihren Fahrplan zu konfigurieren.

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_14.en: New stops can be created, their order can be changed and the specific item and amount can be specified for each stop.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_14.de: Neue Haltestellen k√∂nnen hinzugef√ºgt werden, die Reihenfolge kann ge√§ndert werden und die spezifischen Gegenst√§nde und Mengen k√∂nnen f√ºr jeden Halt festgelegt werden.

dialogue_tutorial_3_father_15.en: Can you make the carriage transport all flour from our windmill to the bakery?
dialogue_tutorial_3_father_15.de: Kannst du daf√ºr sorgen, dass die Kutsche alles Mehl von der Windm√ºhle zur B√§ckerei transportiert?

dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_16.en: Great job! You have completed the tutorial.
dialogue_tutorial_3_prompt_16.de: Gro√üartige Arbeit! Du hast das Tutorial abgeschlossen.

dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_0.en: My lordship, may I enter? I have urgent news to report.
dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_0.de: Euer Gnaden, darf ich eintreten? Ich bringe dringende Kunde.

dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_1.en: While I was cleaning the mansion I found a book titled "Industrialization".
dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_1.de: W√§hrend ich das Herrenhaus s√§uberte, entdeckte ich ein Buch mit dem Titel "Industrialisierung".

dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_2.en: I have never heard of something like that before, and the book seems quite hard to read too...
dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_2.de: Nie zuvor habe ich von etwas dergleichen vernommen, und das Buch ist zudem h√∂chst schwer zu entziffern...

dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_3.en: Oh! My lordship, please excuse me. I should not have peeked into the book without prior consent.
dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_3.de: Oh! Euer Gnaden, verzeiht mir. Es war nicht meine Absicht, ohne Eure Erlaubnis in das Buch zu blicken.

dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_4.en: I will swiftly put it into the bookshelf.
dialogue_tutorial_4_maid_4.de: Ich werde es sogleich im B√ºcherregal verstauen.

dialogue_tutorial_4_prompt_5.en: Interact with the bookshelf to read the book.
dialogue_tutorial_4_prompt_5.de: Interagiere mit dem B√ºcherregal, um das Buch zu lesen.

dialogue_tutorial_4_prompt_6.en: Press the escape key to pause the game and save, change settings or exit.
dialogue_tutorial_4_prompt_6.de: Dr√ºcke die Escape-Taste, um zu pausieren und zu speichern, Einstellungen zu √§ndern oder zu verlassen.

dialogue_tutorial_4_prompt_7.en: You are now the count of this county and free to manage it however you like.
dialogue_tutorial_4_prompt_7.de: Du bist hiermit der Graf dieses Bezirks und kannst es verwalten, so wie du es m√∂chtest.
